Preventive maintenance for cars involves routine checks and services designed to keep the vehicle running smoothly and safely, while preventing breakdowns and costly repairs.

Major maintenance for a car typically involves more extensive inspections, repairs, or replacements that go beyond routine preventive maintenance. These services are often necessary after a certain mileage or time period and can significantly enhance the vehicle\'s performance and longevity

Minor maintenance for a car involves routine tasks that help keep the vehicle running smoothly and efficiently without the extensive measures seen in major maintenance. These tasks are generally less time-consuming and less expensive but are essential for the vehicle\'s health.

General maintenance for a car encompasses a combination of both minor and major maintenance tasks aimed at ensuring the vehicle runs efficiently and reliably over time. It involves routine inspections, fluid checks, and component replacements that help prevent breakdowns and extend the vehicleâ€™s lifespan.
